content: Can anyone suggest a place to start to learn about FHIR in a Health Information Exchange (HIE)?...
That's a very broad question. What do you want to know about HIEs and FHIR?

Yes, sorry... I've been asked to gather some information on implementing FHIR within an HIE, perhaps around orders-based workflows, but I'm having trouble finding anything. When I asked similar questions in the past (one was about Social Determinants of Health and I can't recall the other), I got responses suggesting some FHIR projects I should explore and it was very helpful.
Thanks for your response, and I'll try to learn a little first and then come back to this chatroom...

as Dave points out, the question is too open-ended... That said, IHE has defined an Document Sharing HIE that uses a set of FHIR Resources. This is outlined in the Mobile Health Document Sharing (MHDS) implementation guide.
https://wiki.ihe.net/index.php/Mobile_Health_Document_Sharing_(MHDS)
video introduction
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CX8q4hThmII&list=PLqKdd_74t4IL86rg1DhfsPq1LVS3jF4QK
my blog on it
https://healthcaresecprivacy.blogspot.com/2020/02/mobile-health-document-sharing-mhds.html#more

There's a community of practice that has defined an HIE architecture based on IHE Profiles: OpenHIE (https://ohie.org/#arch). The latest version of this architecture is based on FHIR (and heavily references the MHDS profile).
